algorithm_technique: Simulate ant movement, or realize ants passing through each other is equivalent to them not interacting.
problem_summary_simple: Find the time when the last ant falls off a plank of given length.
problem_summary_technical: The last ant to fall is determined by the ant furthest from an edge, considering its direction.
time_complexity: O(L + R) where L is length of left array, R is length of right array
key_insights: When two ants meet and change direction, it's equivalent to them passing through each other without changing direction.
The last ant to fall is the one that takes the longest to reach an edge.
For ants moving left, the furthest is `max(left)`. For ants moving right, the furthest is `n - min(right)`.
